item.title: how to solve permission error from airflow official docker image
item.description: what i learned tl;dr: when you use the Airflow official docker image you need to make sure that the variable AIRFLOW_UID is set to match your UID (and AIRFLOW_GID=0 aka root ) or you’re going to get permission errors. i was working on deploying Airflow on a VM at work this week and I got a permission error (Errno 13) regarding the containers’ python’s logging config. When I first started working with this docker-compose.
